hints.consequence: How did you feel and act?

entry.title: Your words are clues
entry.intro: The way you explain what happened reveals your perspective. We looked at your words to see how you viewed this specific event in three ways.
entry.permanence: Did you explain this as a temporary occurrence, or something that will last a long time?
entry.pervasiveness: Did you describe this as happening in just this one area, or affecting everything you do?
entry.personalization: Did you link the cause to what you did (your actions), or who you are (your character)?

week.title: Your Weekly Thinking Pattern
week.intro: Across your entries this week, we looked for habits in how you explain ups and downs.
week.permanence: Do you tend to view problems as permanent roadblocks, or temporary bumps?
week.pervasiveness: Do you tend to connect events to everything you do, or do you see them as isolated?
week.personalization: Is your habit to look for causes in who you are, or in what you did?

analysis.disclaimer: This analysis is generated by AI and is for self-reflection purposes only. It is not a substitute for professional mental health advice.

stale.paused_message: Updates paused to enable deeper thinking.
stale.refresh_from_entry_detail: To regenerate this analysis, navigate to the Entry Detail.
stale.nudge_message: You've refined this quite a bit. Consider moving on to the next phase after refreshing.

aiDisclaimer.title: Before we analyze
aiDisclaimer.not_medical_desc: This AI is a tool for self-reflection, not a doctor. It cannot diagnose mental health conditions.
aiDisclaimer.accuracy_desc: AI can make mistakes. Please use your own judgment when reading the insights.
aiDisclaimer.data_desc: Your entry text will be sent to our secure AI provider solely to generate this response.

quickstart.title: Let's untangle your thoughts.
quickstart.story_intro: When things go wrong, we often tell ourselves a <bold>story</bold> about why it happened.
quickstart.abc_body: An <bold>Adversity (A)</bold> happens. You form a <boldBelief>Belief (B)</boldBelief> about it. That belief drives the <bold>Consequence (C)</bold>, how you feel and act.
quickstart.citation: Seligman, M. E. P. (2011). Learned optimism: How to change your mind and your life. Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group.
quickstart.reframe_intro: We can change how you feel by looking at that <bold>story</bold> again.
quickstart.solution: Together, we’ll use <boldDispute>Disputation (D)</boldDispute> to challenge negative thoughts, helping you find <boldEnergy>Energy (E)</boldEnergy> and a clearer perspective.
quickstart.pivot_desc: You can continue on your own, or get an optional AI assisted analysis based on your <bold>A + B + C</bold>.
quickstart.quick_path_desc: Continue with the <bold>standard questions</bold> for <boldDispute>Dispute (D)</boldDispute> and <boldEnergy>Energy (E)</boldEnergy>.
quickstart.guided_path_desc: Get an <bold>analysis</bold> of your entry and <bold>tailored questions</bold> specific to your entry.

work.label: Work Stress
work.adversity: I sent a report with a typo in the title.
work.consequence: I felt anxious and avoided checking replies.
work.dispute: One typo isn’t my whole track record. I can send a quick correction.
work.energy: More steady. I fixed it and moved on.

social.label: Social Anxiety
social.adversity: I texted a friend and didn’t hear back for a few hours.
social.consequence: I felt tense and avoided checking replies.
social.dispute: They might be busy. A late reply does not equal rejection.
social.energy: Calmer. I put my phone down and did something else.

internal.label: Self Criticism
internal.adversity: I overslept and missed the gym.
internal.consequence: I felt ashamed and acted like the day was “ruined.”
internal.dispute: One missed session does not erase progress. I can reset today.
internal.energy: Kinder to myself. I planned a simple workout for tomorrow.
